episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" revolves around the peculiarities and humorous aspects of elections, both in the UK and internationally. The hosts discuss forfeited election deposits going to the Queen, unusual political parties and candidates, the use of symbols in elections in Kenya, and historical oddities like constituencies with no residents.

facts.fact: All forfeited election deposits go straight to the Queen.
Only one political party in this 2017 election offered to do anything about yetis.
Kenya have an election later this year and they're running out of symbols for their candidates, which means that candidates are now using symbols such as a milk packet, a termite and a robot.
In the 19th century, one of England's constituencies had no people living in it and another one was underwater.
